Greetings.Japanese: おはよう ございます
ありがとう ございます
おめでとうございます

DaysOfTheWeek.Japanese: なんようび ですか
きょうは なんようび ですか？

Daily_Phrases.English: Thank you for the food (Before eating)
Thank you for the food (After eating)
Welcome (To customers in a shop, store, etc.)

Daily_Phrases.Japanese: どうぞ おあがりください
いっしょに いかがですか
また こんど おねがいします
Daily_Phrases.English: Please ask me some other time

Daily_Phrases.Japanese: もういっぱい いかがですか
Daily_Phrases.English: Would you like to have one more cup?

Daily_Phrases.Japanese: いいえ、けっこう です
もういちど おねがいします
Daily_Phrases.English: Can you repeat one more time?

Daily_Phrases.Japanese: そろそろ しつれいします

PersonalPronouns.English: You (formal; used carefully as it can sound distant or impolite)
That person (polite equivalent of あのひと)

Titles&Honorifics.English: Affectionate suffix for children or close friends
Suffix for boys or male juniors
Suffix meaning 'a national of' (e.g., アメリカじん = American)

Professions&Roles.English: Teacher, instructor (not used for one’s own job)
Teacher, instructor (used for one’s own job)
Employee of a specific company (e.g., IMCのしゃいん = Employee of IMC)

BasicVocabulary&Phrases.English: ~ years old (used for age, e.g., 25さい = 25 years old)
How old? (polite equivalent of なんさい)

PoliteExpressions1.English: Excuse me, but… (used politely when asking for information)
How do you do? (lit. I am meeting you for the first time; used at the start of a self-introduction)

PoliteExpressions1.Japanese: どうぞよろしく［おねがいします］。
PoliteExpressions1.English: Pleased to meet you. (lit. Please be nice to me; usually said at the end of a self-introduction)

Self-IntroductionPhrases.Japanese: アメリカからきました。

Demonstrative Pronouns.English: That (thing over there, away from both speaker and listener)
This ~ (used with a noun, e.g., このほん = this book)
That ~ (used with a noun, e.g., そのかばん = that bag near you)
That ~ (used with a noun, e.g., あのとけい = that watch over there)

Vocabulary.English: ~ Language (e.g., フランスご = French language)

Phrases1.English: No, it isn’t. / You are wrong.
It’s nothing. / It’s a token of my gratitude.
Please. / Here you are. (used when offering something)

Phrases1.Japanese: ［どうも］ありがとう［ございます］

Polite Expressions2.Japanese: これからおせわになります
Polite Expressions2.English: I hope for your kind assistance hereafter.
I am pleased to meet you, too. (response to どうぞよろしく)

Places and Directions.English: This way, this place (polite equivalent of ここ)
That way, that place near you (polite equivalent of そこ)
That way, that place over there (polite equivalent of あそこ)
Which way, where (polite equivalent of どこ)

Places and Countries.English: Osaka (name of a station in Osaka)

Daily Activities.English: Take a rest, take a holiday

Days and Holidays.English: Rest, a holiday, a day off
